question: ScienceDaily (May 8, 2009) — In the face of rising unemployment and businesses declaring bankruptcy, a new study has found that losing your job can make you sick. Even when people find a new job quickly, there is an increased risk of developing a new health problem, such as hypertension, heart disease, heart attack, stroke or diabetes as a result of the job loss. The study will be published in the May 8 issue of Demography.http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2009/05/090508045310.htm
title: Job Loss Can Make You Sick, New Study Finds
